12/1/24: Proposal on divestment from companies linked to “gross violations of human rights and international law,” annotated

This proposal takes a different approach by not specifically targeting Israel or Palestinian rights, mimicking one of the three divestment proposals the University offered to expedite through the ACSRI during April 2024 negotiations. The word “Israel” appears in the proposal only once, and the word “Palestine” does not appear in the proposal. Seven references to “Gaza” appear in the footnotes, but never in the text of the proposal.

The writers emphasize that the consensus for the proposal lies in the basic ethical principles of the University.

Source: Spectator reporting, ACSRI proposals

Graphics by Ava Fung
